entries.meaning: A valve, tap or faucet which regulates the flow of liquid or gas through a pipe.
(Britain) A main shutoff for water to a home from a municipal supply. Usually these valves exist in pairs, one outside the property boundary and one inside the property boundary.
examples: If you have a burst pipe, turn the water off at the stopcock.

verbs.description: stopcock (third-person singular simple present stopcocks, present participle stopcocking, simple past and past participle stopcocked)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To control the gas pressure in (an oil well) by keeping the well closed in and the gas confined except during set intervals when the oil is flowed or pumped.
